what: Add Fonts With One Core Function
title: Download and Register Fonts from GDPR-Compliant Providers For Use In R graphics
text: add font R, simply call add_font() font family name retrieved Bunny Fonts website. example, add ‚ÄúOswald‚Äù font:
code: library(AddFonts) # Download and register Oswald font add_font("oswald") #> ‚úî Downloaded variant: 'bunny-oswald-latin-400-normal.ttf' #> ‚úî Downloaded variant: 'bunny-oswald-latin-700-normal.ttf' #> ‚úî Font "oswald" registered and added to cache.

title: Download and Register Fonts from GDPR-Compliant Providers For Use In R graphics
text: preview_font() function plots downloaded registered variants font family one go. picked font, instance ‚ÄúMerriweather‚Äù, calling preview_font() function show variants, ‚ÄúMerriweather‚Äù 4: regular, bold, italic, bold-italic.
code: library(AddFonts) preview_font("merriweather", regular.wt = 400, bold.wt = 700)

what: Add Fonts And Use With ggplot2
title: Download and Register Fonts from GDPR-Compliant Providers For Use In R graphics
text: Let‚Äôs imagine want use several fonts simple plot. First, loop vector font family names call add_font() one download register R. Now fonts registered, can use ggplot instance.
code: library(AddFonts) library(showtext) library(ggplot2)  fonts <- c(   "oswald",   "blaka-ink",   "barrio",   "major-mono-display",   "merriweather",   "montserrat",   "sixtyfour",   "playfair-display",   "inter",   "aboreto",   "aclonica",   "akronim",   "babylonica" )  for (font in fonts) {   add_font(font) } showtext_auto()  font_data <- data.frame(   x = 0.5,   y = seq(0.95, 0.1, length.out = length(fonts)),   label = paste(tools::toTitleCase(gsub("-", " ", fonts)), "Font"),   family = fonts,   size = c(9, 8, 8, 6, 8, 8, 7, 8, 8, 8, 8, 8, 9) )  ggplot(   font_data,   aes(x = x, y = y, label = label, family = family, size = size) ) +   geom_text(hjust = 0.5) +   scale_size_identity() +   xlim(0, 1) +   ylim(0, 1) +   theme_void()
